summary: a single stranded positive-sense RNA virus in the genus Alphacoronavirus, family Coronaviridae, order Nidovirales, is a causative agent of porcine epidemic diarrhea (PED) (1). PED is endemic in Asia (3–8), has been reported in Europe (2, 9), and its recent emergence in North America suggests a threat to the swine industry worldwide (10). the sizes of the other six open reading frames, including S, ORF3, E, M, and N, are 4,158 nt, 675 nt, 231 nt, 681 nt, and 1,326 nt. the 3′ UTR is 334 nt in length. the three new PEDV isolates share high similarity. bank under accession numbers KJ960178 through KJ960180.
